[SIZE=4]Well i was trying to work on a stock aircraft carrier, and had this build in the VAB, as you can see it has many mk3 cargo ramps for the top deck, but is really only about 100 parts
[/SIZE][IMG]http://imgur.com/xlzJuUm.jpg[/IMG][SIZE=4]
In the SPH i get a ton of lag, and it is almost like a 1000 part craft, not a 100 part craft, but when i launch it, I get ALOT less lag. It also seems like the longer I work on it, the laggier it becomes. Is there some sort of memory leak with the mk3 cargo ramps, or is it just me being an idiot (it seems to be exclusively them)[/SIZE]

I've always noticed the KSP slowly get more laggy the longer it runs. Restart the game if its feeling sluggish compared to startup. As for you're main question, my money is on the ramps hogging your RAM for some reason.
I would think that the ramps might be a little memory hoggy, especially with more yello-timewarp on my crafts with the ramps. Try decreasing the ramps if you can...

Lag != Memory Leak. Memory Leaks do not cause lag and lag does not cause memory leaks. Lag is caused by either overusing the CPU or overusing the GPU (most likely the former in KSP), and memory leaks cause the game to crash. Running out of RAM doesn't cause the computer to run slower. Anything can cause lag in KSP with enough of them, animated parts even more so. That doesn't mean anything is wrong with the part, you are just exceeding it's design limitations. Edited November 17, 2015 by Alshain

I guess i am exceeding it... thanks for clarifying it, i am kinda nooby at that stuff. It just seemed REALLY laggy, even compared to when i just used a regular cargo bay. Dang, gonna have to redesign that then... :P
Looks like you've got about 20 ramps there, opening up to ,,, themselves. What did you have in mind here? Just curious.
